newsitem.title: UK: Japanese stocks in UK stronger, helped by dollar.
newsitem.headline: Japanese stocks in UK stronger, helped by dollar.

text.p: Japanese stocks in London were slightly stronger on Wednesday, helped by a firm dollar which supported leading exporters, although activity remained relatively thin.
"We've seen a bit of a change in sentiment today with people starting to shift money around, taking profit in one area and moving it into the underperforming areas," one trader said.
The dollar was trading at 126.78 by 1550 GMT.
In Tokyo on Wednesday the 225-share Nikkei average ended the day 318.33 points, or 1.77 percent lower at 17,703.37.
Dealers noted activity in some banking stocks. Fujitsu Ltd was trading at 1,305 yen in London compared with its Tokyo close of 1,300 yen.
